page.title: 18Employment in Morwenstow
page.content: The largest single employer without doubt is {CSOS,}but the specialised nature of the work and lack of nearby housing makes it necessary to travel into the area to work although many of the staff have been recruited from further away. Agriculture, tourism and trades related to the upkeep and maintenance of buildings and machinery account for most of the remaining employment. The smaller numbers now required for farm work means that work has to be sought away from home. Among these the area can claim nurses, schoolteachers, engineers, doctors and social workers as representatives. Reminders of bygone industry still remain with the once busy corn mill at {Coombe}and memories still alive of the blacksmith's shop in the hamlet of {Woodford}and the old quarry at nearby {Beacon Down.
